perturbation.original_text:
iv)  e-centives will pay for these General Program Member User Data
               records to Excite@Home at a rate of $***** per unique User Data
               record. This rate will apply only to the first ***** records.
               e-centives will pay Excite@Home $***** in payments for these
               General Program Member User Data records over the Term of
               this Agreement, in accordance with the schedule set out in
               Section 7.d. In the event that more than ***** such General
               Program Member User Data records are supplied, payments for such
               additional records shall be governed by Section 7.e.
perturbation.changed_text:
iv)  e-centives will pay for these General Program Member User Data
               records to Excite@Home at a rate of $***** per unique User Data
               record. This rate will apply to all records without limit.
               e-centives will pay Excite@Home $***** in payments for these
               General Program Member User Data records over the Term of
               this Agreement, in accordance with the schedule set out in
               Section 7.d. In the event that more than ***** such General
               Program Member User Data records are supplied, payments for such
               additional records shall be governed by Section 7.e.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment terms. The original clause states that the rate of $***** per unique User Data record applies only to the first ***** records, while the changed clause removes that limitation, stating that the rate applies to all records without limit. This creates uncertainty about the total amount payable, as one part of the section restricts payment to the first bloc of records while another specifies payment for all records delivered.

perturbation.original_text:
d)   Payment Schedule
     i)   Within ten (10) days of the Effective Date of this Agreement,
          e-centives shall make a non-refundable payment to Excite@Home of
          $***** as pre-payment for Payment-Eligible User Data records:
          (1)  e-centives will pay Excite@Home $***** in pre-payments for
               ***** General Program Member User Data records.
          (2)  e-centives will pay Excite@Home $***** in pre-payments for
               ***** Qualified Program Member User Data records.
     ii)  During the Term of this Agreement, on the first day of each quarter
          following the quarter in which the Launch Date falls, e-centives shall
          make additional non-refundable payments for the Payment-Eligible User
          Data records. In the event that the Launch Date is delayed beyond
          March 31, 2000, the April 1, 2000, payment pursuant to this subsection
          shall be postponed and shall instead be made within (10) days of the
          Launch Date. Payments under this subsection shall be calculated as
          follows:
               (1)  General Program Member User Data: $*****, plus $*****
                    times the total number of records previously delivered, less
                    all amounts previously paid on account of General Program
                    Member User Data.
               (2)  Qualified Program Member User Data: $*****, plus $*****
                    times the total number of records previously delivered, less
                    all amounts previously paid on account of General Program
                    Member User Data.
perturbation.changed_text:
d)   Payment Schedule
     i)   Within ten (10) days of the Effective Date of this Agreement,
          e-centives shall make a non-refundable payment to Excite@Home of
          $***** as pre-payment for Payment-Eligible User Data records:
          (1)  e-centives will pay Excite@Home $***** in pre-payments for
               ***** General Program Member User Data records. This payment shall be refundable if Excite@Home fails to deliver data.
          (2)  e-centives will pay Excite@Home $***** in pre-payments for
               ***** Qualified Program Member User Data records.
     ii)  During the Term of this Agreement, on the first day of each quarter
          following the quarter in which the Launch Date falls, e-centives shall
          make additional non-refundable payments for the Payment-Eligible User
          Data records. In the event that the Launch Date is delayed beyond
          March 31, 2000, the April 1, 2000, payment pursuant to this subsection
          shall be postponed and shall instead be made within (30) days of the
          Launch Date. Payments under this subsection shall be calculated as
          follows:
               (1)  General Program Member User Data: $*****, plus $*****
                    times the total number of records previously delivered, less
                    all amounts previously paid on account of General Program
                    Member User Data.
               (2)  Qualified Program Member User Data: $*****, plus $*****
                    times the total number of records previously delivered, less
                    all amounts previously paid on account of General Program
                    Member User Data.
perturbation.explanation: This change introduces a contradiction in the payment schedule. The original text states that the initial payment is non-refundable, while the modified text indicates that only the payment for General Program Member User Data will be refundable if Excite@Home fails to deliver data. There is also a change in the delay for payments from (10) to (30) days. This creates ambiguity regarding the conditions under which payments must be returned, potentially leading to financial disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
ii) Each Party will pay all earned and undisputed outstanding amounts owed
          to the other Party under this Agreement within thirty (30) days after
          the effective date of such termination. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
          all payments for User Data records shall be due and accrue in
          accordance with terms of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
ii) Each Party will pay all earned and undisputed outstanding amounts owed
          to the other Party under this Agreement within ninety (90) days after
          the effective date of such termination. Notwithstanding the foregoing,
          all payments for User Data records shall be due and accrue in
          accordance with terms of this Agreement, but are not required until 180 days following termination.
perturbation.explanation: This change creates a contradiction by extending the payment deadline to ninety (90) days after termination but then adds that payments for User Data records are not required until 180 days following termination. This creates confusion around which deadline applies to User Data payments, potentially delaying payments and leading to disputes.
